title: Must I Go And Empty-Handed?
presentation: v1 c v2 c v3 c v4 c

v1: Not one day of service give Him,
Lay no trophy at His feet?
v2: Not at death I shrink nor falter,
For my Savior saves me now;
Thought of that now clouds my brow.
v3: Oh, the years of sinning wasted,
Could I but recall them now,
I would give them to my Savior,
To His will I'd gladly bow.
v4: Up ye saints, arouse, be earnest,
Up and work while yet 'tis day;
Ere the night of death o'ertakes you,
Strive for souls while still you may.
c1: Must I meet my Savior so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him,
